column1: Breredon (Briar Hill) was a little village in Buckland near Haysend on rising ground behind the hythe
column3: on the north bank of the Withywindle in the narrow tongue between the south end of the High Hay and the Baranduin River.

column1: It has been suggested that Breredon is consisting of the elements brere ("wikipedia:Brier") + -don ("down
column3: "http://lalaith.vpsurf.de/Tolkien/Bombadil_in_the_Shire.html Bombadil in the Shire" at http://lalaith.vpsurf.de/M-earth.html Middle-earth Science Pages (accessed 16 March 2011)

column1: This etymology would represent a possible Old English form *Braerdun "hill of briers".
